page.title: 07Guest Houses
page.content: There are a great many guest houses in Scarborough. People on holiday stay for bed, breakfast and evening meal. It costs Â£7 to Â£9 per person per day. The landlady gets up at about 6.00 in the morning and has to make the breakfast and get everything into the hot cupboards. Then the bell rings for breakfast at about 9.00. The landlady will circulate and talk to the visitors. The guests then go out for the day, making their own arrangements for lunch. Meanwhile the landlady washes up and makes the beds. She may go to the cash and carry for more food. In the afernoon she prepares the evening meal for the visitor's return at 5.30. Afterwards they may go out again to the amusements or theatre returning at 10.30 for a light supper. The tired landlady will still chat to them before retiring exhausted to bed.
